description:
Hi everyone, this was a first test with my brand new ZWO 7x2" EFW, The first night I have some several issues of tilt in the imaging train due to the added wheight because the wheel and the 7 2" filters, but I could solve it at least fot now for the second night.

That's the reason that I could only get 4 h of each channel, and the clouds appear, so Sii must wait for clearer nights. Also the Moon was full, so no best condition for photography, but I really wanted to try the filter wheel, and it is magical. Before the wheel I have to screw the filter in use on the thread of the coma corrector of my newton telescope, and for changing filter I have to take the camera out, unscrew one filter an screw the other one, for that reason I always did 1 channel for each night. Now I can get Ha, Oiii and Sii on the same night, this is a huge improvement in my setup.

The Image is a Bicolour image, mapping the colors was creating a synthetic green R:Ha, G:Ha*Oiii*1.3 and B:Oiii. 

Hope you like it and stay safe.

Clear Skies, Ariel.
title: The Bok Globules in IC 2948 Running Chicken Nebula (Bicolor)
